measure.CatchLine: Reduces the minimum number of years that property must have been the homestead of an individual before the property is eligible for the homestead property tax deferral program.
measure.MeasureSummary:
Digest: The Act makes a home eligible for tax deferral after three years of living in it instead of five. (Flesch Readability Score: 67.3). 
	Reduces the minimum number of years that property must have been the homestead of an individual before the property is eligible for the homestead property tax deferral program. 
	Takes effect on the 91st day following adjournment sine die.
measure.RelatingToFull: Relating to eligibility criteria for the homestead property tax deferral program; creating new provisions; amending ORS 311.670; and prescribing an effective date.
measure.RelatingTo: Relating to eligibility criteria for the homestead property tax deferral program; prescribing an effective date.
measure.AtTheRequestOf: (at the request of Governor Tina Kotek for Department of Revenue)
measure.FiscalImpact: May have fiscal impact, but no statement yet issued
measure.RevenueImpact: May have revenue impact, but no statement yet issued

sponsors.PresessionFiledMessage: Introduced and printed pursuant to House Rule 12.00.  Presession filed

historyActions.ActionText: First reading. Referred to Speaker's desk.
